What is Melanoma?

The most dangerous form of skin cancer, these cancerous growths develop when unrepaired DNA damage to skin cells (most often caused by ultraviolet radiation from sunshine or tanning beds) triggers mutations (genetic defects) that lead the skin cells to multiply rapidly and form malignant tumors. These tumors originate in the pigment-producing melanocytes in the basal layer of the epidermis. Melanomas often resemble moles; some develop from moles. The majority of melanomas are black or brown, but they can also be skin-colored, pink, red, purple, blue or white. Melanoma is caused mainly by intense, occasional UV exposure (frequently leading to sunburn), especially in those who are genetically predisposed to the disease.



If melanoma is recognized and treated early, it is almost always curable, but if it is not, the cancer can advance and spread to other parts of the body, where it becomes hard to treat and can be fatal. It is not the most common of the skin cancers.

Symptoms of Melanoma :

The first sign of melanoma is typically a new spot on the skin, or a change in the size, shape or color of an existing mole. The ABCDE method may help you determine whether an abnormal skin growth may be melanoma:



Asymmetry: The mole has an irregular shape.

Border: The edge is not smooth, but irregular or notched.

Color: The mole has uneven shading or dark spots.

Diameter: The spot is larger than the size of a pencil eraser.

Evolving or Elevation: The spot is changing in size, shape or texture.

The only way to be sure if a mole is melanoma is to have it examined by a doctor.





Other melanoma symptoms may include:



Sores that do not heal

Pigment, redness or swelling that spreads outside the border of a spot to the surrounding skin

Itchiness, tenderness or pain

Changes in texture, or scales, oozing or bleeding from an existing mole

Blurry vision or partial loss of sight, or dark spots in the iris

These are examples of they types of treatment available for melanoma. Based on your personal history, pathology report, and stage at diagnosis, your doctor may recommend one or more of the following:

Surgery

Surgery is the mainstay of therapy for early stage melanoma and for the resection of an isolated metastatic melanoma site. There are several different types of surgeries that are regularly performed to treat melanoma.

Radiation

Radiation therapy uses high energy rays, like x-rays, to kill cancer cells. Although radiation is not an overly common melanoma treatment option, it is most often used as a symptom-relieving therapy in patients whose melanoma has spread to the brain or bones.

Clinical Trials

Clinical trials are research studies to test promising new or experimental cancer treatments. There are hundreds of clinical trials happening at any given time, and most experts agree that for a late-stage diagnosis, clinical trials are the best treatment option. You can also visit our Clinical Trial Finder to learn about clinical trials that are available.

Bringing Machine Learning ( ML ) to Android :

The machine learning model used in this application is built using TensorFlow Python APIs. TensorFlow is a great machine learning framework and can run its models on Android as well as on iOS. TensorFlow Lite is an optimum API which helps to transform TensorFlow models so that they could be loaded on IOT devices.

About the model :

The application demonstrates the working of a Convolutional Siamese Neural Network. It has been created with TensorFlow Keras. Less training period along with simpler architecture are some of the features kept in mind while creating the model. Also, quantization helped in reducing the size of the inference model which would otherwise diminish the performance of the model.

Firebase Services :

Firebase has been providing a number of free services which are scalable and outstanding. The application uses Firebase Realtime Database and Firebase Cloud Storage to download the images necessary for the classification of Melanoma.

Training/Validation Data:

The data was scraped from the web by Shubham Panchal as no such datasets were readily available. The model has been trained on augmented images to its best accuracy. The developer tends to extend this technology for the classification for more diseases in future.
